author: AMISHA PANDEY
description: A viral video of Cardi B celebrating Stefon Diggs' birthday with affectionate gestures has set social media ablaze. The clip, showing the rapper and NFL star in a close embrace, has sparked widespread debate among fans, with reactions ranging from adoration to skepticism about their relationship's authenticity. This public display has intensified interest in both celebrities' personal lives.
title: Cardi B and Stefon Diggs get cozy in viral birthday clip as fans say 'Mom & Dad'

author: TNN
description: Tata Electronics is set to manufacture Intel's advanced AI laptop chips and employ cutting-edge packaging technologies at its new Gujarat and Assam facilities. This significant collaboration aims to boost India's semiconductor ambitions, enhance cost-effectiveness, and accelerate market entry for Intel, tapping into the nation's burgeoning AI PC demand.
title: Tatas to make chips, laptops for Intel in Gujarat, Assam

author: TOI
description: India has demanded assurances from China that its citizens won't face selective harassment after an Arunachal Pradesh resident was reportedly mistreated at Shanghai airport. New Delhi strongly protested the incident, reaffirming Arunachal's status as an integral part of India. The MEA advised Indian nationals to exercise caution when traveling to or transiting through China.
title: China must assure us our citizens won't be harassed: India

author: TOI
description: As West Bengal gears up for elections, opposition parties have rallied against the government, alleging that the Vande Mataram discussion is a calculated distraction from more urgent matters at hand. Priyanka Gandhi Vadra joined the fray, pointing out Prime Minister Modi's faltering support and ineffective strategies, while invoking Jawaharlal Nehru's firm opposition to communal favoritism linked to the national anthem.
title: Vande Mataram debate a diversion, timed for Bengal elections: Oppn

author: SEHJAL GUPTA
description: Pastor Mark Driscoll ignited a social media storm by calling commentator Candace Owens a "sorceress" and comparing her to a "queen bee." The exchange drew significant attention, prompting many to inquire about Driscoll, the pastor of Trinity Church in Scottsdale, Arizona. He is known for his direct style and strong opinions on faith and culture.
title: Candace Owens faces fresh heat after Mark Driscoll calls her a ‘sorceress’

author: TNN
description: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh proposed adding a fundamental duty to the Constitution, mandating equal respect for 'Vande Mataram' as the national anthem. He accused Congress of communalizing the song due to appeasement politics, urging parliamentarians to restore its glory and honor its author. Singh highlighted historical attempts to truncate the song, deeming it an injustice to national identity.
title: Give Vande Mataram same status as Jana Gana: Rajnath Singh

author: TNN
title: India welcomes UK action against Babbar Khalsa network

author: TNN
description: In a fiery session in Parliament, Trinamool Congress slammed the government for allegedly using the 'Vande Mataram' discourse as a political distraction ahead of the West Bengal elections, branding it as a 'poorly executed farce.' MPs voiced their concerns over the BJP's 'polarizing' tactics, while Akhilesh Yadav from SP labelled their moves as 'nationally contentious.
title: Vande Mataram debate done with eye on Bengal poll, says TMC

author: NAOMI CANTON
description: A British Sikh man, Capt. Jay Singh-Sohal, has been honored with an OBE by the Princess Royal for establishing the UK's first WWI Sikh Memorial. This memorial at the National Memorial Arboretum commemorates the sacrifices of Sikh soldiers who served Great Britain.
title: British Sikh man with roots in rural Punjab receives OBE from Princess Anne

author: MANASH PRATIM GOHAIN
description: A crucial parliamentary panel has raised alarming issues regarding the handling of the National Testing Agency's (NTA) exams in 2024, highlighting repeated delays, incidents of paper leaks, and various mistakes. The committee has advocated for a shift back to traditional pen-and-paper assessments, similar to those used by CBSE and UPSC.
title: Critical of NTA, panel says return to pen-paper tests

author: NASEER GANAI
description: The Jammu and Kashmir High Court has granted the administration and the Centre three months to respond to petitions challenging a ban on 25 Kashmir-related books. The ban, imposed by the home department, claims the books promote a "false narrative" and "secessionism." A three-judge bench will hear the petitions, which argue the ban violates free speech guarantees.
title: Explain Kashmir book ban, HC tells LG admin, Centre

author: MAHIMA ROY
description: Chargers' star player Omarion Hampton is nearing a return after a fractured ankle sustained in Week 5. Despite being listed as questionable, insiders suggest he'll be activated off injured reserve for tonight's game against the Eagles.  This potential comeback bolsters a Chargers team enjoying a strong season.
title: Omarion Hampton injury update: Insider reveals RB’s Week 14 status

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Lok Sabha witnessed a heated debate on the national song 'Vande Mataram' on its 150th anniversary. The BJP accused the Congress of disrespecting the song and appeasing the Muslim League, while the opposition alleged the ruling party was politicizing it for electoral gain and distracting from key issues.
title: Vande Mataram debate: From PM Modi to Priyanka Gandhi what leaders said - key points

author: NASEER GANAI
description: A Chinese national was questioned for visa violations after travelling to J&K and Ladakh without permission. Meanwhile, authorities discovered multiple foreign nationals staying in Kashmir without mandatory reporting, leading to FIRs against several hotels and houseboats for non-compliance with Form-C submission norms.
title: Chinese national released; cops find immigration violations by hotels, homestays, houseboats

author: DIPAK K DASH
description: Following recent bus fires, Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari has ordered government-approved agencies to inspect all sleeper coach buses for safety norm compliance. This directive comes after reports of widespread non-compliance with the new Bus Body Code, leading to calls for action against errant builders and officials.
title: Gadkari directs officials to carry out checking of all sleeper buses by govt-approved agencies

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: India's largest airline, IndiGo, is recovering from a week of unprecedented disruption caused by new pilot duty norms. The crisis led to mass flight cancellations, stranded passengers, and significant financial losses, with over Rs 1,396 crore refunded. The government has imposed fare caps to stabilize prices.
title: IndiGo crisis: Rs 827 cr refunds, 1,800+ flights operated; recovery explained in key nos

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: A powerful 7.6 magnitude earthquake rocked northern Japan, triggering a tsunami of up to 70 centimeters and prompting evacuations for tens of thousands. Several injuries were reported, with fires breaking out in Aomori. Authorities have formed an emergency task force and are conducting safety checks on nuclear plants, which have shown no issues so far.
title: Japan earthquake: Several reported injured, evacuation advised; what we know

author: SANJAY KHAJURIA
description: A massive forest fire erupted along the Line of Control in Rajouri and Poonch districts on Sunday, with dense smoke billowing up. The blaze, likely originating from across the border, is spreading rapidly due to dry conditions and has triggered multiple landmine blasts in forward areas without any reported injuries.
title: Smoke billows along LoC areas of Rajouri-Poonch on 2nd day also

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Over 50 lakh Central government employees and 69 lakh pensioners will be covered under the 8th Pay Commission, with its Terms of Reference notified on November 3, 2025. The commission, headed by Justice Ranjana Prakash Desai, will examine pay, allowances, and pensions. Implementation timelines and funding will be decided later, following the commission's submission of recommendations within 18 months.
title: 8th pay commission: Govt shares major update in LS; what’s next for employees

author: CHIDANAND RAJGHATTA
description: A resurfaced video of an Indian-American immigration attorney's profanity-laced attack on Donald Trump at an IT lobbying conference has sparked a furious MAGA backlash. The incident intensified scrutiny of the H-1B visa system, leading entrepreneur Vivek Ramaswamy to withdraw from an upcoming ITServe conference.
title: Under fire from MAGA, Indian IT lobbying group aligns with Trump

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: A special parliamentary discussion on 150 years of Vande Mataram became a platform for political sparring ahead of the Bengal assembly elections. While the ruling party highlighted the song's legacy and attacked the Congress, the opposition accused the BJP of using the debate for poll prospects.
title: Vande Mataram debate: NDA, opposition trade barbs over national song; Bengal poll takes centre stage

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Paramount has launched a $108 billion hostile bid for Warner Bros Discovery, directly challenging Netflix's earlier acquisition agreement. This move ignites a major media battle, with Paramount offering shareholders significantly more cash and a faster completion. The outcome could dramatically reshape global entertainment, controlling iconic franchises like HBO and Harry Potter.
title: $108-bn hostile bid: Paramount moves to take over Warner Bros; challenges Netflix’s $72-bn offer

author: CHIDANAND RAJGHATTA
title: China's trillion dollar triumph amid Trump's tariff tantrum

author: SAURABH SINHA
description: IndiGo has apologized for massive flight disruptions, citing new flight duty rules, winter schedule changes, technical glitches, weather, and system congestion. The airline requested more time from the DGCA for a full analysis, while the aviation minister vowed strict action against IndiGo for its internal crisis.
title: DGCA notice response: IndiGo blames 5 factors for mess; seeks more time for detailed reply

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: North Goa nightclub owners, Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra, fled to Phuket hours after a fire killed 25 people. Police confirmed their departure and issued a Look Out Circular, seeking Interpol's help.  Four staff members have been arrested as a magisterial inquiry into procedural lapses is underway.
title: Goa nightclub fire: Owners fled to Phuket within hrs of blaze; 'intent to evade probe'

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Hardik Pandya is on the verge of a significant T20I milestone, needing 140 runs for 2,000 and just two wickets for 100. Returning from injury, he proved his fitness and is a key player for India's T20 World Cup preparations. The five-match series against South Africa begins December 9.
title: Hardik Pandya inches toward history: Indian all-rounder on cusp of major T20I milestone

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: A powerful 7.6 magnitude earthquake off Japan's northern coast has triggered a tsunami alert for Hokkaido and surrounding areas.  Country recorded as high as 40-centimetre (16-inch) tsunami. Earlier the Japanese meteorological agency had issued warning of waves up to three meters.
title: Magnitude 7.6 earthquake strikes Japan; 16-inch tsunami wave recorded

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: A resurfaced 2016 video reveals Sam Altman's admiration for Elon Musk, asking how to become the "next Elon Musk." Musk outlined his college blueprint focused on maximizing usefulness, identifying key areas like multiplanetary life and sustainable energy. This contrasts with their current rivalry, marked by Musk's criticism of OpenAI and Altman's expansion into space ventures.
title: Musk’s interview with Altman: 'How to be next Elon' - When OpenAI CEO asked Tesla CEO

author: NIKITA PATNAIK
description: William Nylander is set to play for the Toronto Maple Leafs against the Tampa Bay Lightning tonight, a significant boost for the team.  Despite a minor injury, Nylander's return strengthens Toronto's offense, crucial for facing Tampa Bay's formidable defense.  Fans anticipate a dynamic matchup with Nylander expected to be a key player.
title: NHL match today: Will William Nylander play against Tampa Bay Lightning tonight?

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Shubman Gill and Hardik Pandya return to India's T20I squad for the South Africa series, impacting the middle order. Despite Sanju Samson's good form, captain Suryakumar Yadav confirmed Gill will open, with Samson batting in the middle. Jitesh Sharma's recent performance also intensifies competition for middle-order spots.
title: 'We gave Sanju opportunities': Samson to get dropped from the playing XI again?

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: India's MEA spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal stated that "democracy and Pakistan don't go together" while monitoring developments. He also highlighted strong India-US counter-terrorism cooperation, with both nations pushing for tougher UN actions against Pakistan-based terror groups like LeT and JeM.
title: Weakening democracy? MEA's cutting response: 'Pakistan and democracy don't go together'

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Porsche owners in Russia faced a bizarre shutdown as their cars refused to start. A malfunctioning security tracker, designed to deter thieves, mistakenly identified the vehicles as stolen, triggering the immobilizer. This widespread issue, affecting various Porsche models made since 2013, has left owners stranded without official support due to Porsche's exit from Russia.
title: When Porsche cars across Russia came to a standstill - reason behind it

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Boston Bruins defenseman Charlie McAvoy has opened up for the first time since suffering a severe facial injury that has kept him out of the lineup. The NHL star detailed the extent of the damage, the unexpected challenges he’s facing daily, and why his recovery remains a difficult road. His comments offer clarity for fans following ongoing NHL injury updates.
title: Charlie McAvoy Injury: Boston Bruins star reveals difficult recovery

author: PRANAV SHUKLA
description: Chennai Super Kings enter IPL 2026 at a crossroads, carrying both legacy and last-place disappointment. Major trades, including Jadeja and Curran’s exit and Samson’s arrival, signal a new direction. With gaps in finishing, spin and pace, CSK head into the auction with a big purse and urgent needs as they prepare for life beyond MS Dhoni.
title: IPL 2026: What CSK need & who they must target ahead of auctions - Check out

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Despite nearly a decade of US tariffs, China's trade surplus has surged to a record $1.08 trillion, demonstrating its resilience and dominance in global exports. China has successfully restructured its supply chains, rerouted exports to emerging markets, and leveraged currency advantages to bypass tariff barriers, outmaneuvering US trade war strategies.
title: The trillion-dollar shock: What tariff? How Xi Jinping beat Trump in trade war

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: Donald Trump set to fire ICE queen Kristi Noem: Report

author: TOI Education
description: Lakshita Bhagtani transitioned from biotechnology to management studies at the University of Exeter, navigating the complexities of international education. She highlights the importance of thorough research, managing unexpected expenses like daily transport, and adapting to a new academic environment. Building a community and balancing studies with part-time work were crucial for her successful transition.
title: Indian student discloses real preparation needed for studying in the UK

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan urged Shubman Gill to seize his T20 opening opportunity against South Africa, emphasizing the need to solidify his spot for the 2026 World Cup. Pathan also highlighted the crucial search for a reliable finisher to support Hardik Pandya, naming Axar Patel, Jitesh Sharma, and Rinku Singh as potential candidates for the vital role.
title: 'Now or never for Shubman Gill': Former India all-rounder fires warning ahead of T20Is

author: TIMESOFINDIA.COM
description: Microsoft shareholders gave the thumbs up to CEO Satya Nadella's hefty 22% pay raise, even though Norway's massive $2 trillion sovereign wealth fund wasn't on board. This fund, which also questioned Elon Musk's pay, voiced worries about how executives are compensated, their locked-in stock, and the risks tied to key individuals.
title: One common thing in shareholder protests against salary hikes for Nadella, Musk

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Indian chess prodigy R Praggnanandhaa has earned a coveted spot in the Candidates 2026 tournament by triumphing in the FIDE Circuit 2025. His stellar year, marked by victories in major events, secures his sole male representation for India. Seven participants are confirmed, with one remaining spot to be decided by rating.
title: Praggnanandhaa becomes first Indian to qualify for Candidates 2026

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Punjab: Congress suspends Navjot Kaur Sidhu after her 'Rs 500 crore suitcase' charge

author: AASHISH SAXENA
title: Trump to make Buddha 'smile'? 27 yrs since Pokhran nuclear tests, India at critical point

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: India's vice-captain Smriti Mandhana has resumed cricket training following the cancellation of her wedding to composer Palash Muchhal. She will soon return to competitive cricket in a T20I series against Sri Lanka, which serves as preparation for the T20 World Cup. Mandhana had previously confirmed the wedding's cancellation and emphasised her commitment to cricket.
title: After wedding cancelled, Smriti Mandhana's brother shares update on her next move

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: India's Ministry of External Affairs has urged Chinese authorities to ensure fair treatment for Indian travelers transiting through their airports. This statement follows reports of alleged harassment of an Arunachal Pradesh woman, prompting an advisory for Indian nationals to exercise caution when traveling to or through China.
title: 'Assure Indians won't be selectively targeted': MEA's strong message to China

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: India cricketer Smriti Mandhana has confirmed her wedding to music composer Palash Muchhal is called off, following weeks of speculation. Teammate Jemimah Rodrigues has provided significant emotional support throughout the ordeal. Mandhana, however, remains focused on her cricket career, emphasising her commitment to representing India.
title: 'Be the man I need': Jemimah' post goes viral after Smriti Mandhana calls off wedding

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: India's defence aviation is set for a significant upgrade with Tata Advanced Systems and Lockheed Martin inaugurating a dedicated C-130J Super Hercules MRO facility in Bengaluru. This collaboration strengthens in-country sustainment for the Indian Air Force and aims to serve global operators, boosting India's defence manufacturing capabilities and aerospace ecosystem.
title: Boost for IAF: Tata - Lockheed Martin announce new defence MRO facility in India

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi fiercely attacked the Congress in Lok Sabha, accusing the party of compromising on the national song 'Vande Mataram' from the freedom movement to post-Independence. He criticized Jawaharlal Nehru's handling of opposition to the song, stating the Congress "fragmented" it and "bowed to the Muslim League," ultimately leading to the country's partition.
title: 'Bowed to Muslim League': PM Modi's sharp attack on Nehru over Vande Mataram; takes 'MMC' dig at Cong

author: YASHIKA BAJAJ
description: India's first bullet train project is rapidly transforming into a reality, with significant progress on tunnels, bridges, and stations.  The Mumbai-Ahmedabad corridor, built with Japanese technology, is set to revolutionize travel, cutting journey times drastically.  Key milestones in 2025, including advanced tunnel breakthroughs and the adoption of next-gen Shinkansen trains, signal India's entry into the global high-speed rail league.
title: Bullet train '25: India bets big on steel bridges, mega tunnels & high-speed infra

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Trinamool MP Sugata Roy objected to PM Modi referring to Bankim Chandra Chatterjee as "Bankim Da" in Lok Sabha, suggesting "Bankim Babu" instead. The Prime Minister accepted the correction, highlighting the song's significance in India's struggle against colonial rule and its role in the Swadeshi movement.
title: ‘Can I call you Dada?’: TMC MP objects to PM Modi calling Bankim Chandra 'Da’; gets heartful reply

author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
description: A common childhood virus, BK virus, dormant in the urinary tract, is now linked to DNA damage increasing bladder cancer risk. Research reveals how the body's antiviral response can inadvertently harm its own DNA, explaining cancer development even without viral traces. This discovery offers new prevention avenues beyond smoking cessation.
title: Common childhood virus found to play a hidden role in bladder cancer development: Study

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon warns Europe's bureaucratic hurdles and economic fragmentation are pushing businesses and innovation away, posing risks to both the continent and the US. He urges Washington to bolster Europe, emphasizing a strong ally is crucial for American security.  JPMorgan is investing $1.5 trillion in US economic security industries.
title: 'Driving innovation out': JP Morgan CEO warns of 'slow bureaucracy'

author: PROSHUN CHAKRABORTY
description: Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Aaditya Thackeray accused the Maharashtra government of fearing the opposition despite its majority, citing the handling of the Council's Leader of Opposition appointment. He also criticized Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis for deleting a social media post on the IndiGo crisis and questioned the use of chartered flights by BJP leaders amid passenger suffering.
title: 'Fear of opp': Aaditya Thackeray targets BJP for charter flights amid IndiGo chaos

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Hawaii's Kīlauea volcano erupted again on Friday, with lava fountains reaching 370 meters. The USGS camera capturing the event was buried in debris. This marks the 38th eruption since December, though it remains confined to the national park, posing no threat to communities. Monitoring continues as the volcano alternates between eruptions and pauses.
title: Hawaii's Kīlauea volcano erupts again; towering lava fountains soar up to 1200 ft—Watch

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Amit Passi etched his name in T20 history by equaling the world record for the highest individual score on debut, smashing 114 off 55 balls for Baroda against Services. His explosive knock, featuring 10 fours and nine sixes, helped Baroda post 220/5 and has put him on the radar of IPL franchises.
title: History made: Hardik Pandya's Baroda teammate Amit Passi equals T20 world record

author: SANJAY SHARMA
description: Bill Gates, co-founder of Microsoft and philanthropist, inspires students worldwide through his words on learning, ambition, and social responsibility. His messages emphasise lifelong learning, resilience, and innovation, motivating young minds in STEM, entrepreneurship, and global development. Top quotes highlight personal growth, embracing failure, and the importance of technology and guidance. Students report increased engagement, curiosity, and career planning, while his philanthropic focus encourages social awareness. Gates’ guidance continues to shape academic and professional goals globally.
title: How Bill Gates’ words inspire students worldwide, driving motivation, learning every day

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: The Japan posts marked the inevitable moment when rumour blurred into reality. Perry did not write an essay or offer an explanation. She simply uploaded a carousel of her trip: serene landscapes, neon streets, sushi dinners and then, suddenly, Justin Trudeau, smiling like a man who had very intentionally chosen this era of his life. The caption, “tokyo times on tour and more”, was vague in the way bold announcements often are. The emoji selection — hearts, flowers, soft smiles — did the rest of the heavy lifting. Trudeau, for his part, had already warmed the public to the idea by sharing a photo of the two with Japan’s former prime minister and his wife. It was the sort of diplomatic cameo that would have looked routine if not for the unmistakable sense that something more was happening beyond the frame.
title: Justin Trudeau and Katy Perry make it Instagram official: A cheat-sheet to their romance

author: SRINATH VUDALI
description: A man, an accused in a double murder case, was brutally attacked and killed in Jawaharnagar. Stabbed, bludgeoned with stones, and then shot, the victim was identified as inspector Venkataratnam. Police suspect past enmity as the motive and are using CCTV footage to identify the assailants who fled the scene.
title: Knives, stones, bullets: Man accused in double-murder case shot dead in Hyderabad

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Global billionaires have reached an all-time high in 2025, with their wealth soaring to $15.8 trillion, largely driven by tech gains in AI. Despite this boom, concerns about tariffs and geopolitical tensions persist. A significant wealth transfer is also underway, with trillions set to pass to heirs in the coming years.
title: Made of money! Billionaire club hits record high — How much their children will inherit

author: JYOTIRMOY HALDER
description: Russian Grandmaster Volodar Murzin, the 2024 FIDE Rapid champion, is set to compete in the Global Chess League in Mumbai. He expressed his fondness for Indian cuisine, particularly mangoes, paneer, and sugarcane juice. Murzin also shared his confidence boost after winning the World Rapid title and his ambition to improve his classical chess game.
title: 'Mango, Paneer ...': Not just chess on Russian GM's mind as GCL makes India debut

author: Deutsche Welle
title: Myanmar: Drug production booming amid civil war

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: Acquitted Malayalam actor Dileep accused police and media of a conspiracy to frame him in the 2017 actress assault case, aiming to ruin his career. He alleged a senior female officer and "criminal-minded" colleagues fabricated a false narrative with media support, which the court has now dismissed.
title: ‘Only after Manju's statement’: Actor Dileep's 1st remark after rape acquittal; hints at ex-wife

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: 'Only two reasons': Priyanka targets govt over Vande Matram debate; brings in 'Bengal election'

author: TOI BUSINESS EXPERTS
description: The Reserve Bank of India has cut the repo rate by 25 basis points, signaling a dovish outlook amid slowing growth expectations. This move, coupled with liquidity infusion measures, aims to boost the real economy. Despite strong headline GDP figures, the policy focuses on future growth sustainability, considering moderating base effects and manageable inflation.
title: RBI MPC meet: What economic signals prompted the 25 basis points rate cut?

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Congress criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi for allegedly rewriting history and politicizing the Lok Sabha debate on 'Vande Mataram'. Deputy leader Gaurav Gogoi accused the PM of repeatedly mentioning Nehru and Congress to revise historical contributions. Gogoi asserted Congress's pivotal role in elevating 'Vande Mataram' to national song status, highlighting its adoption at party sessions.
title: ‘Rewriting history’: Gaurav Gogoi slams PM over Vande Mataram debate

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: Goa's Arpora nightclub fire, claiming 25 lives, has spotlighted elusive hospitality entrepreneur Saurabh Luthra. Activists and survivors describe him as a "ghost" rarely present in Goa, with ventures expanding despite alleged safety lapses and lack of official registrations. Investigations reveal critical oversights, raising questions about accountability for the deadly tragedy.
title: ‘Saurabh Luthra is like a ghost’: Activists slam Goa nightclub owner after fire

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Ravichandran Ashwin has appealed to Indian cricket fans for more constructive online discussions. He highlighted the negative trend of personal attacks following recent team performances. Ashwin stressed that debates should focus on selection and on-field output, not on labeling players. He believes this approach will foster a more positive environment for the sport and its followers.
title: 'Stop the character assassination': Ashwin slams toxic fan culture after Gambhir backlash

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: India's 2025 cricket season saw young stars like Abhishek Sharma and Vaibhav Suryavanshi dominate search trends, even in Pakistan. While India triumphed over rivals on the field, it was these emerging talents who captured global attention, signaling a significant generational shift in cricket's digital landscape and highlighting the growing influence of women's cricket.
title: Top Google Searches: India crowns teenage phenomenon; Pak obsessed with young Indian opener

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: President Trump is again suggesting tariffs could replace federal income taxes, claiming rising tariff revenue will eliminate income tax needs. However, federal data shows individual income taxes are the primary funding source, with tariffs contributing a small fraction. Experts deem the proposal mathematically and economically unworkable, citing disproportionate burdens on lower-income households and risks to economic growth.
title: US Prez says tariffs can replace federal income taxes — but do the numbers back him?

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Vande Mataram debate in LS: Cong counters PM Modi's attack on Nehru; poses 3 questions

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi in the Lok Sabha, accusing him of lacking historical facts in his Vande Mataram debate. She highlighted Rabindranath Tagore's first rendition at a Congress convention and the song's role in the freedom struggle, contrasting it with the PM's narrative of Congress compromises.
title: Vande Mataram debate: Priyanka's 'chronology' jab at Centre; questions PM's 'selective' history

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Aviation minister K Rammohan Naidu has vowed "very, very strict action" against IndiGo for its recent flight disruptions, citing internal lapses in crew management and roster planning. He clarified the issue is unrelated to past system malfunctions, emphasizing that the airline's mismanagement caused the crisis.  Naidu stressed that accountability is paramount, promising to set an industry example.
title: 'Very strict action': Aviation minister vows to 'set example' after IndiGo crisis

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Indian cricketer Smriti Mandhana and music composer Palash Muchhal have officially called off their wedding, which was previously postponed due to Mandhana's father's hospitalisation. Both stars confirmed the cancellation on Instagram, with Mandhana urging for privacy and emphasising her continued focus on representing India in cricket.
title: Wedding cancelled: Smriti Mandhana & Palash Muchhal unfollow each other on social media

author: etimes.in
description: Aditya Dhar's 'Dhurandhar', starring Ranveer Singh, has achieved a remarkable feat by crossing Rs 100 crore at the box office within its opening weekend. The film saw impressive growth, with Sunday collections soaring to Rs 43 crore. This strong performance marks one of Ranveer Singh's most successful opening weekends to date.
title: ‘Dhurandhar’ BO collection: Ranveer Singh starrer crosses Rs 100 cr in India over opening weekend

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: IndiGo's operational crisis continues for a seventh day with over 500 flight cancellations nationwide, stranding thousands of passengers. The Supreme Court declined to intervene, acknowledging government action. The airline attributes the disruptions to crew rostering and internal planning issues following new pilot duty time regulations.
title: IndiGo crisis: Over 500 flights cancelled, Rs 827cr refunds initiated — key points

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi initiated a special 10-hour debate in the Lok Sabha on the 150th anniversary of Vande Mataram. The song, adopted as India's National Song, is being discussed in both Houses this week. Modi highlighted historical parallels, linking the song's milestones to national challenges like British rule and the Emergency.
title: '100th anniversary fell during Emergency': PM leads Vande Mataram debate- top quotes

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: India secured a 2-1 ODI series victory against South Africa.  The win was celebrated with light-hearted moments in the dressing room.  Virat Kohli playfully teased Kuldeep Yadav, who was named Impact Player of the Series.  Kuldeep had a stellar performance, taking nine wickets.  The team now prepares for a T20I series.
title: 'Ro de, ro de': Virat Kohli teases Kuldeep Yadav as spinner wins Impact Player of the Series

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are hovering near recent highs, fueled by expectations of a US Federal Reserve rate cut. Weak US jobs data and dovish Fed commentary have bolstered this sentiment. Investors are keenly awaiting the Fed's policy decision and Chair Jerome Powell's remarks for further direction, with central bank buying and ETF inflows providing support.
title: Gold price prediction today: What is the price outlook in the coming days?

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Taylor Swift's unwavering support for Travis Kelce was evident at another Kansas City Chiefs game, this time against the Houston Texans. Spotted with Selena Gomez, Swift's presence continues to captivate fans and amplify NFL broadcasts. Her fifth appearance this season highlights a growing crossover between music, sports, and entertainment, drawing in a wider audience eager for these celebrity game-day moments.
title: Taylor Swift and Selena Gomez shine at Chiefs game as Swift’s support for Kelce goes viral

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Stock market crash today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, tanked in trade on Monday. While Nifty50 went below 25,900 intraday, BSE Sensex was down over 700 points.
title: Nifty50 goes below 25,900; BSE Sensex down over 700 points - why is market crashing?

author: TNN
description: Police apprehended a 24-year-old man in Uttam Nagar after he allegedly broke into a house in Mohan Garden. Disguised as a woman to avoid CCTV detection, he stole jewellery, watches, and a handicam with an associate. The arrest has helped solve ten theft and snatching cases. Recovered items include silver anklets, a handicam, and five mobile phones.
title: Cross-dressing crook: Burglar dressed as woman arrested in Delhi; 14-day chase busted heist

author: TNN
description: Trinamool MLA Humayun Kabir expressed readiness to ally with AIMIM for the 2026 Bengal polls, despite his party's strong criticism. Kabir, who recently laid the foundation for a mosque, also claimed CPM, ISF, and Congress were open to alliances, assertions immediately denied by those parties. His political journey has seen multiple party switches.
title: From Congress to TMC to BJP: Humayun Kabir’s AIMIM alliance pitch rattles Bengal parties

author: MAHIMA ROY
description: Los Angeles Chargers quarterback Justin Herbert, despite a recent hand injury requiring surgery, is reportedly optimistic about playing against the Philadelphia Eagles. NFL insider Jeremy Fowler suggests Herbert will be "good to go," with the team also hopeful. Herbert himself expressed a strong desire to return, treating it as if he's playing Monday.
title: Justin Herbert injury update: Insider reveals QB’s status for Eagles clash after surgery

author: NEWTON SEQUEIRA
description: Nightclubs in Goa are fire hazards. Experts say many operate without fire department NOCs. Pyrotechnics and combustible materials increase risks. Regulations exist but compliance is low. Basements are particularly dangerous. A recent fire at Romeo Lane highlights these critical issues.
title: 'Most of them are fire hazards': What makes nightclubs a recipe for disaster

author: DINESH SHARMA
description: A 17-year-old girl, presumed dead for two months after her father allegedly threw her into a canal, has reappeared alive in Ferozepur. She claims her father is innocent, motivated by her mother's instigation, and demands his release while accusing her mother of being the true culprit. Police are investigating the video and will record her official statement.
title: ‘True culprit is my mother’: Punjab girl thrown into canal by father 2 months ago 'reappears'
